shortDescription: Intentional social media usage limits for reclaimed time, focus, and mental health
scientificBenefits: Better sleep quality (less blue light exposure)
Increased productivity and time for meaningful activities

researchCitations.study: Hunt et al. (2018) - Journal of Social and Clinical Psychology
researchCitations.finding: Limiting social media to 30 min/day significantly reduced depression and loneliness
Heavy social media use (5+ hours/day) increases suicide risk indicators by 71%
People check phones average 85 times/day; each context switch costs 23 minutes of focus

commonBarriers: FOMO (fear of missing out) on updates
No clear boundaries or daily limits set
progressionPlan: Week 1: Track current usage (awareness). Week 2-3: Set 2-hour daily limit, remove from home screen. Week 4-5: Reduce to 90 minutes, designate scroll-free zones (bed, meals). Week 6-8: Target 30-60 min/day, intentional-only usage.
nooLifeFeatureHighlight: Track social media minutes daily. Set personal limits. GTA-style phone-away visuals. Contributes heavily to Focus and Discipline ratings. Inverse tracking: less usage = higher rating gains.
testimonial: "Was on Instagram 4+ hours daily. NooLife helped me cut to 45 min. Got 3 hours back every day. Mental clarity is unreal." - Sophia K.
ctaAngle: Take control of your screen time with accountability tracking. Free 3-day trial.
